snippet: The opposition leaders had been convicted of atrocities dating back to the 1971 war for independence from Pakistan, going through trials that had been criticized as biased toward the prosecution.
abstract: Bangladeshi authorities execute Salahuddin Quader Chowdhury and Ali Ahsan Mohammad Mojaheed, senior opposition leaders charged with war crimes committed during 1971 war for independence against Pakistan.

byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik contributed reporting from Dhaka, Bangladesh.

lead_paragraph: The opposition leaders had been convicted of atrocities dating back to the 1971 war for independence from Pakistan, going through trials that had been criticized as biased toward the prosecution.

headline.main: Bangladesh Hangs 2 Leaders Convicted of War Crimes
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Hangs 2 Leaders Convicted of War Crimes

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
